Issues.Title: The result of Screen.FromPoint() is wrong.
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.net8

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

_No response_

### Issue description

I want to konw which screen the cursor in when mousemove in the form by using the code blow:
```C#
        private void Form1_MouseMove(object sender, MouseEventArgs e)
        {
            var screen = Screen.FromPoint(MousePosition);
            this.label1.Text = $"{screen.DeviceName}";
        }
```
It seem can't get which screen the mouse is in exactly.
![screen](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/47862827/dc5277cf-d0ee-426c-890e-ab95a434f293)
The background color purple is screen1 and black is screen2.

### Steps to reproduce

Move the form between the two screens and move the mouse.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The result of Screen.FromPoint() is wrong." (#10663)

Issues.Title: The caret is in the wrong place When typing into a MaskedTextBox using JP IME,
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.net8

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

_No response_

### Issue description

![MaskedTextBox](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/47862827/b5115e20-9d0f-42f4-929c-270274f916c1)
Typing some words to MaskedTextBox using Japanese IME, the position of the caret will always be in the leftmost part of the textbox if Select All (CTRL+A) first

> 

### Steps to reproduce

1. Drag and drop a MaskedTextBox to the designer form from the toolbox.
2. Set MaskedTextBox Mask property to `(999) 000-0000`
3. Run application.
4. Click the MaskedTextBox and press `Ctrl+A`.
5. Type `123` to the MaskedTextBox by using  MS JP IME and then press `Enter`.
6. The caret position still at the start of MaskedTextBox (it's wrong).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The caret is in the wrong place When typing into a MaskedTextBox using JP IME, " (#10662)

Issues.Title: Running the control fails, displaying "The type 'IHandle<>' is defined in an assembly that is not referenced"
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

9.0.100-alpha.1.24062.11

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes

### Issue description

Running the control fails, displaying "The type 'IHandle<>' is defined in an assembly that is not referenced."
In the latest .Net 9.0 SDK build: 9.0.100-alpha.1.24062.11, an exception pops up:

_The type 'IHandle<>' is defined in an assembly that is not referenced. You must add a reference to assembly 'System.Private.Windows.Core, Version=9.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089'._

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/104609169/32139b56-6fa1-4bfa-800d-0b30407e9ca5



### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a Winforms .Net application
2. Add a NumericUpDown control to form designer
3. Build and run application

**More info:**

1. There is a **workaround**: manually add "**System.Private.Windows.Core.dll**" to the project. The project can run normally
2. This issue occurs in the following controls: NumericUpDown, TrackBar, Process, DataGridView, PictureBox, SplitContainer
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Running the control fails, displaying "The type 'IHandle<>' is defined in an assembly that is not referenced"" (#10661)

Issues.Title: Failed to get installed printers in System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.get_InstalledPrinters()
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

9.0.100-alpha.1.24062.11

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes

### Issue description

Failed to get installed printers in System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.get_InstalledPrinters(), may be caused by PR: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10598

In the latest .Net 9.0 SDK build: 9.0.100-alpha.1.24062.11, an exception pops up:
_System.ComponentModel.Win32Exception
  HResult=0x80004005
  Message=**The parameter is incorrect.**
  Source=System.Drawing.Common
  StackTrace:
   at System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.get_InstalledPrinters()
   at PrinterListForm.Form1.LoadPrinters() in C:\Users\xxx\source\repos\PrinterListForm\PrinterListForm\Form1.cs:line 14
   at PrinterListForm.Form1..ctor() in C:\Users\xxx\source\repos\PrinterListForm\PrinterListForm\Form1.cs:line 8
   at PrinterListForm.Program.Main() in C:\Users\xxx\source\repos\PrinterListForm\PrinterListForm\Program.cs:line 14_



### Steps to reproduce

Build and run following a sample project:
[PrinterListForm.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/13935622/PrinterListForm.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Failed to get installed printers in System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.get_InstalledPrinters()" (#10659)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[main] Update dependencies from dotnet/runtime" (#10656)

Issues.Title: Use inbox throw helpers in System.Drawing.Common
Issues.Body:
Now that System.Drawing.Common dropped support for .Net Framework, we can take advantage of throw helpers.

## Proposed changes

- Use ArgumentOutOfRangeException.ThrowIf* across System.Drawing.Common and remove some custom error messages
- Use ArgumentNullException.ThrowIfNull across System.Drawing.Common
- Use ObjectDisposedException.ThrowIf across System.Drawing.Common

## Customer Impact

- Slightly better perf

## Risk

- minimal

## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

CI



###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10655)

Issues.Title: make it possible to announce label automatically with screenreader when focusing in window
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

8.0

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No

### Issue description

I have a form, which has one label, a progressbar and a cancel button.
When i am showing a from from another form, a title of window is announced and cancel button.
even if i show form with showDialog same thing occures.

### Steps to reproduce

create form described in issue description.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "make it possible to announce label automatically with screenreader when focusing in window" (#10652)

Issues.Title: Convert Rest of Ole to Cswin32
Issues.Body:
- Adds test to capture our wrapping behavior:  
    - Data coming in must implement `System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IDataObject` to be taken as is. If it does not, we will wrap the data in a `DataObject`
    - Data going out must implement `System.Windows.Forms.IDataObject` to be passed out as is. If it does not, we will wrap the data in a `DataObject`
- Convert the remaining ole functions to Cswin32
- Other minor clean ups

*Currently in draft to understand clipboard behavior

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10651)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Convert Rest of Ole to Cswin32" (#10651)

Issues.Title: Move IgnoredReferences to Own Props File
Issues.Body:
Place `IgnoredReferences` tag added in https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10639 in its own props file for windowsdesktop to consume to avoid tight coupling.

cc: @ericstj

Issues.Title: Update initial function and add function GetStandardValuesByCulture i…
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #10610


## Proposed changes

- Update GetStandardValues to get the get standard values by CultureInfo.InvariantCulture

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- The KeysConverter.GetStandardValues() can be used normally

## Regression? 

- Yes 

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->


## Screenshots <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

### Before

Simply calling

`var test = new KeysConverter().GetStandardValues();`

throws the exception:

`System.Collections.Generic.KeyNotFoundException: 'The given key 'en-US' was not present in the dictionary.'`

### After

Call `var test = new KeysConverter().GetStandardValues();` to return standard key values

## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Manually

## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->

- .net 9.0.0-alpha.1.24058.11


<!-- Mention language, UI scaling, or anything else that might be relevant -->

Issues.Title: Remove remaining `Interop` code from System.Drawing
Issues.Body: Remove most of the code in the Interop class. Only COM items remain. GDI+ APIs still need finished.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Remove remaining `Interop` code from System.Drawing" (#10645)

Issues.Title: Pull DeviceContextHdcScope into Core
Issues.Body:
This gets DeviceContextHdcScope down to the core assembly which will allow using it in System.Drawing to finally remove the last remnants of WindowsGraphics.

It adds a few interfaces to abstract away System.Drawing types and moves transform application to the HDC into Graphics.

Issues.Title: Update EnsureRun to return null when _textRegion is null
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #10630 , #10555


## Proposed changes

- Update function `EnsureRun ` to return null when _textRegion is null

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- UI can be show normally when scrolling

## Regression? 

- Yes 

## Risk

Issues.Title: Ignore System.Private.Windows.Core in FileClassification
Issues.Body:
This helps with failures in https://github.com/dotnet/windowsdesktop/pull/4063. We want System.Private.Windows.Core to be in the runtime pack of the shared Framework, so this does not need to be omitted from FrameworkListFile 

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10639)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Ignore System.Private.Windows.Core in FileClassification" (#10639)

Issues.Title: Remove *I overloads and move scopes
Issues.Body:
Int overloads just cast to float, removing non-array ones to cut back on interop code.

- Fix some missing KeepAlives
- Move error handling for GdiPlus to Core
- Move some scopes down and convert RegionScope to use IPointer

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10640)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Remove *I overloads and move scopes" (#10640)

Issues.Title: Reduce the build verbosity for AxHosts.csproj
Issues.Body:
This reduces the amount of noise that appears in the build output window in Visual Studio.
